text: Johann Gottlieb Fichte (;"Fichte". Random House Webster's Unabridged Dictionary. ; May 19, 1762 â€“ January 27, 1814), was a German philosopher. He was one of the first philosophers of the movement known as German idealism. He died of typhus in Berlin. == References == Category:1762 births Category:1814 deaths Category:18th-century German philosophers Category:19th-century German philosophers Category:Deaths from typhus Category:Disease-related deaths in Berlin Category:Infectious disease deaths in Germany Category:People from Saxony
